meanings.definition: Relating to the study of microscopic fossils.
meanings.sent1: The micropaleontological research revealed tiny ancient fossils.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use micropaleontological techniques to analyze microscopic remains.
meanings.sent3: The micropaleontological findings were so small, they almost went unnoticed.
meanings.sent4: Her attention to detail was micropaleontological, uncovering hidden clues.
meanings.sent5: The micropaleontological examination required a powerful microscope.

meanings.definition: Involving the analysis of tiny ancient organisms.
meanings.sent1: The micropaleontological study focused on analyzing ancient tiny creatures.
meanings.sent2: Researchers made significant discoveries through micropaleontological investigations.
meanings.sent3: The micropaleontological approach to studying ancient organisms was quite fascinating.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to micropaleontological research was admirable.
meanings.sent5: The micropaleontological examination provided valuable insights into ancient life forms.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the examination of small prehistoric remains.
meanings.sent1: The micropaleontological analysis uncovered details about small prehistoric remains.
meanings.sent2: The team used micropaleontological methods to study ancient tiny fossils.
meanings.sent3: Her micropaleontological expertise was crucial in identifying the ancient remains.
meanings.sent4: The micropaleontological investigation shed light on the history of the small prehistoric artifacts.
meanings.sent5: Through micropaleontological research, they were able to piece together the story of the ancient remains.
